title: Kelabit Bible - Gospel of Luke Portions (1940)
description: Kayeli (Indonesian: Bahasa Kayeli) is an extinct Austronesian language once used by the Kayeli people of the Indonesian island Buru. Two dialects were recognized, namely Leliali (Liliali) and Lumaete (Lumaiti, Mumaite, Lumara).

language.name: Kelabit
language.area: Northern Sarawak, remotest and highest Borneo mountains. Also in Indonesia (Kalimantan).
